definitions.definition: To prevent , delay or hinder something by taking precautionary or anticipatory measures ; to avert .
examples: Fred forestalled disaster by his prompt action.

definitions.definition: To preclude or bar from happening, render impossible.
examples: In French, an aspired h forestalls elision .

definitions.definition: To purchase the complete supply of a good, particularly foodstuffs, in order to charge a monopoly price.
To obstruct or stop up, as a road; to stop the passage of a highway; to intercept on the road, as goods on the way to market.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To prevent , delay or hinder something by taking precautionary or anticipatory measures ; to avert .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To preclude or bar from happening, render impossible.
( archaic ) To purchase the complete supply of a good, particularly foodstuffs, in order to charge a monopoly price.
( UK , law ) To obstruct or stop up, as a road; to stop the passage of a highway; to intercept on the road, as goods on the way to market.
